pullRequest.title: Support for non-api mediaccc links, invidious shortened links, refactor mediaccc tests
pullRequest.bodyText:
I carefully read the contribution guidelines and agree to them.
 I did test the API against NewPipe.
 I agree to ASAP create a PULL request for NewPipe for making in compatible when I changed the api.

See TeamNewPipe/NewPipe#3090

nodes.bodyText: Why are you catching that FoundAdException? getId doesn't even throw that.
As far as I know this is not good practice, an empty List should be returned instead. Though I am not sure if it is normal to see null instead of empty lists in NewPipeExtractor. Same 5 lines below
Wouldn't it be a better idea to use substring? That's what we want, in the end
In these stream tests you should also check if all stream urls are secure urls (i.e. start with https://)

commit.message: MediaCCCLH: use substring instead of replace; improve a bit tests, return Collections.emptyList(); instead of null where it's annotated @NonNull
check wether mediaccc streams url are secure

beforeCommit.message: MediaCCCLH: use substring instead of replace; improve a bit tests, return Collections.emptyList(); instead of null where it's annotated @NonNull

afterCommit.message: check wether mediaccc streams url are secure
